Description: Wooden plank broken off at both ends. An incomplete painted inscription of 10 lines covers most of one side of the plank. Two holes pierce the plank towards the top left hand corner.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), church 1 south crypt
Exhibition history: 2023-2024 13 Nov-3 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum, Africa and Byzantium
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
